member.summary:
Class PathInformation contains information, used by the Dijkstra algorithm, about the path to reach a :
The minimum cost to reach the from its
The that comes before this one in the path from the source
The that connects the two -s

member.name: M:Draw.io_Graph_Parser.GraphElement.StylePropertiesToString
member.summary: This method converts to string.
member.remarks: It's used to update the style in a node when one of its properties changes.
member.example:
The following properties: KeyValue
ellipse
fillColorâ€Ž#FFD700 will result: "ellipse;fillColor=#FFD700;". It's important to notice that since the ellipse property doesn't have a value, in the string the = sign is omitted.

member.name: T:Draw.io_Graph_Parser.GraphParser
member.summary: Class GraphParser takes a graph in XML format made with https://www.draw.io/ and parses it.
member.remarks: The XML file must be uncompressed.

member.value: The property Graph represents the whole graph in XML format.

member.value: The property Root represents the containing all the -s of the graph elements.

member.name: P:Draw.io_Graph_Parser.GraphParser.Edges
member.value: The property Edges represents the containing all the edges of the graph.

member.name: P:Draw.io_Graph_Parser.GraphParser.Texts
member.value: The property Texts represents the containing all the texts of the graph. Usually they are the cost of the edges.

member.name: M:Draw.io_Graph_Parser.GraphParser.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: This constructor initializes the new GraphParser from a .
member.param: The path of the XML file.
member.remarks: The XML file can be made with https://www.draw.io/. When exporting it, it's fundamental to uncheck the Compressed option.
